required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The EVARREST® Fibrin Sealant Patch Liver Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Randomized, Controlled, Superiority Study Evaluating EVARREST® Fibrin Sealant Patch Versus Standard of Care Treatment in Controlling Parenchymal Bleeding During Hepatic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and hemostatic effectiveness of EVARREST® Fibrin Sealant Patch (EVARREST) versus standard of care treatment (SoC) in controlling parenchymal bleeding during hepatic surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 4-minutes Following Randomization
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis at the TBS at 4-minutes following randomization and with no re-bleeding requiring treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of wound closure. Hemostasis is defined as no detectable bleeding at the TBS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 10-minutes Following Randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization and no further bleeding requiring treatment prior to initiation of wound closure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative, an average of 4.2 minutes following randomization
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute time to achieve hemostasis at or after 4 minutes from randomization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Re-bleeding Events From the TBS During the Study Follow-up
Incidence of Adverse Events That Were Potentially Related to Thrombotic Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events that were potentially related to thrombic events

arm_group.description: EVARREST® Fibrin Sealant Patch is a sterile bio-absorbable combination product consisting of two constituent parts — a flexible matrix and a coating of two biological components (Human Fibrinogen and Human Thrombin).

SoC is a composite of techniques/methods typically used by the surgeon to control bleeding after conventional methods (i.e. suture, ligation, cautery) are ineffective or impractical. For this study, SoC will be initiated with continuous firm manual compression with or without gauze or sponge and with or without a topical absorbable hemostat (example SURGICEL).

results_reference.citation: Koea JB, Batiller J, Aguirre N, Shen J, Kocharian R, Bochicchio G, Garden OJ. A multicentre, prospective, randomized, controlled trial comparing EVARREST™ fibrin sealant patch to standard of care in controlling bleeding following elective hepatectomy: anatomic versus non-anatomic resection. HPB (Oxford). 2016 Mar;18(3):221-8. doi: 10.1016/j.hpb.2015.12.006. Epub 2016 Feb 1.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 4-minutes Following Randomization
outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis at the TBS at 4-minutes following randomization and with no re-bleeding requiring treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of wound closure. Hemostasis is defined as no detectable bleeding at the TBS.
outcome.population: The primary endpoint analysis was based on the Intent to Treat (ITT) analysis set.

group.title: EVARREST™ Fibrin Sealant Patch
group.description: EVARREST™ Fibrin Sealant Patch is a sterile bio-absorbable combination product consisting of two constituent parts — a flexible matrix and a coating of two biological components (Human Fibrinogen and Human Thrombin).

group.title: Standard of Care (SoC)
group.description: SoC is a composite of techniques/methods typically used by the surgeon to control bleeding after conventional methods (i.e. suture, ligation, cautery) are ineffective or impractical. For this study, SoC will be initiated with continuous firm manual compression with or without gauze or sponge and with or without a topical absorbable hemostat (example SURGICEL).

measure.title: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 4-minutes Following Randomization
measure.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostasis at the TBS at 4-minutes following randomization and with no re-bleeding requiring treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of wound closure. Hemostasis is defined as no detectable bleeding at the TBS.
measure.population: The primary endpoint analysis was based on the Intent to Treat (ITT) analysis set.

outcome.title: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 10-minutes Following Randomization
outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization and no further bleeding requiring treatment prior to initiation of wound closure.
outcome.population: The proportion of subjects achieving hemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization was evaluated as a secondary endpoint using the logistic model with treatment and site/institution included in the model.

group.title: EVARREST™ Fibrin Sealant Patch
group.description: EVARREST™ Fibrin Sealant Patch is a sterile bio-absorbable combination product consisting of two constituent parts — a flexible matrix and a coating of two biological components (Human Fibrinogen and Human Thrombin).

group.title: Standard of Care (SoC)
group.description: SoC is a composite of techniques/methods typically used by the surgeon to control bleeding after conventional methods (i.e. suture, ligation, cautery) are ineffective or impractical. For this study, SoC will be initiated with continuous firm manual compression with or without gauze or sponge and with or without a topical absorbable hemostat (example SURGICEL).

measure.title: Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) at 10-minutes Following Randomization
measure.description: Proportion of subjects achieving hemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization and no further bleeding requiring treatment prior to initiation of wound closure.
measure.population: The proportion of subjects achieving hemostatic success at 10 minutes following randomization was evaluated as a secondary endpoint using the logistic model with treatment and site/institution included in the model.

outcome.title: Absolute Time to Hemostasis
outcome.description: The absolute time to achieve hemostasis at or after 4 minutes from randomization.
outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative, an average of 4.2 minutes following randomization
outcome.population: Time to hemostasis (TTH), defined as the absolute time to achieve hemostasis at or after 4 minutes from randomization was evaluated as a secondary endpoint. In one subject in the SoC group, manual compression was not maintained until the 4-minute endpoint, but was released early and a suture was applied, at which point the subject was hemostatic.

measure.title: Absolute Time to Hemostasis
measure.description: The absolute time to achieve hemostasis at or after 4 minutes from randomization.
measure.population: Time to hemostasis (TTH), defined as the absolute time to achieve hemostasis at or after 4 minutes from randomization was evaluated as a secondary endpoint. In one subject in the SoC group, manual compression was not maintained until the 4-minute endpoint, but was released early and a suture was applied, at which point the subject was hemostatic.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were recorded from the time of randomization until 60 days following the study procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study could not be blinded due to difference in groups The efficacy was limited to one bleeding site to minimize the variability in assessing the primary endpoint The sample may not be sufficient to detect a difference in clinical outcomes.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Director of Ethicon Clinical R&D
